meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inviolate.
meanings.sent1: The inviolatenesses of the ancient temple were respected by all.
meanings.sent2: The inviolatenesses of the forest were evident in its untouched beauty.
meanings.sent3: The inviolatenesses of the secret recipe were finally revealed at the family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The inviolatenesses of her heart were shattered by his betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The inviolatenesses of the promise made it unbreakable.

meanings.definition: The condition of being undisturbed or untouched.
meanings.sent1: The inviolatenesses of the library were maintained by the strict librarian.
meanings.sent2: The inviolatenesses of the snow on the mountain peak were breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The inviolatenesses of the cake lasted until the children found it.
meanings.sent4: The inviolatenesses of the night sky were disrupted by the sudden fireworks.
meanings.sent5: The inviolatenesses of the museum artifacts were preserved for generations to come.

meanings.definition: The state of being kept sacred or unbroken.
meanings.sent1: The inviolatenesses of the ancient relic were protected by powerful spells.
meanings.sent2: The inviolatenesses of the tradition were passed down through the generations.
meanings.sent3: The inviolatenesses of the peace treaty were jeopardized by political tensions.
meanings.sent4: The inviolatenesses of the vase were shattered when it fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The inviolatenesses of the friendship remained strong despite the distance.
